go_data.justification: Rabenosyn-5 is targeted to early endosomes in a PI-3-kinase-dependent manner through a FYVE domain.
Rabenosyn-5 is required for fusion of plasma membrane-derived CCVs with endosomes, and for homotypic endosome fusion.
Rabenosyn-5 interacts directly with Rab5 and associates with the Sec1 homologue hVPS45.
Rabenosyn-5 overexpression inhibits cathepsin D processing, suggesting a role in transport of cathepsin D from the Golgi complex to lysosomes.
Rabenosyn-5 contains a FYVE zinc finger, which binds to phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate (PI-3P) on early endosomal membranes.
